channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023100845
item.description:
Report E-2023100845

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-08
  • City: MAYVIEW
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was pulled in for a DOT inspection at the Mayfield MO Scale house during the inspection the officer found a drum was seeping out a small crack in bottom of drum. There was less than and ounce released just enough to leave a small wet spot on the pallet. The drum was packed into a salvage drum to mitigate the release.

  • Description: The forklift operator was attempting to load the skid of UN2922 onto the trailer when the forklift blade punctured the bottom of the drum, ~causing the spill on the dock and in the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023100215
item.description:
Report X-2023100215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the B Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The one can of enamel developed a loose lid and lost its entire contents. No paint clips were found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the Flammable Pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023100186
item.description:
Report X-2023100186

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the A wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: Both Bottles of Natures Force developed loose caps which allowed for a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the All-Other Materials Pallet.
